overview.short: Clostridioides mangenotii is a Gram-positive, anaerobic, spore-forming rod described in human-associated and environmental contexts.
overview.clinical_context: Less commonly encountered than C. difficile; may appear in anaerobic culture workups and requires confirmatory identification.

species_markers.notes: Broad anaerobic growth on non-selective media; selective C. difficile media is less expected in routine ID.
Species-level biochemical calls can overlap; rely on confirmatory identification methods.

common_confusions.reason: Shared anaerobic spore-forming rod phenotype; clinical context and toxin testing are key differentiators.
Overlapping anaerobic spore-forming physiology across clostridial genera.

when_to_question_identification: If toxin testing/NAAT is positive, prioritize C. difficile workup rather than rarer Clostridioides species.
If isolate appears aerotolerant with persistent growth in oxygen, reconsider genus assignment.
If identification relies purely on broad anaerobic biochemical patterns, confirm via MALDI-TOF or sequencing.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Best practical approach to resolve species identity among anaerobic spore-forming rods.
Useful when MALDI-TOF score is low or database coverage is insufficient.

recommended_next_tests.test: C. difficile toxin gene NAAT (rule-out context)
recommended_next_tests.reason: If clinical suspicion is CDI, use NAAT/toxin testing to avoid missing toxigenic C. difficile.
recommended_next_tests.api_kit_example: C. difficile toxin gene NAAT/PCR assay kits (platform-dependent).
